Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani was thrown out trying to score from second on Teoscar Hernández’s single in the fourth.
The Dodgers snapped a two-game losing streak and forced a Game 5.
The Padres were held to seven hits by the Dodgers' bullpen.
Post-Match Reflections: Manny Machado said, 'It’s win or go home.'
The Padres' gamble to start Dylan Cease on short rest backfired.
Yu Darvish is expected to start for the Padres in Game 5.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Freddie Freeman is sidelined by a right ankle sprain.
Will Smith and Gavin Lux each hit a two-run homer for the Dodgers.
The Petco Park-record crowd of 47,773 had hoped to see the Friars again eliminate the hated Dodgers in the NLDS.
